snippet: Volcanic eruptions are among the earth’s most cataclysmic events, but scientists are often reduced to analyzing possibilities within possibilities when making forecasts.
abstract: Scientists and officials are closely watching eruption of Bardarbunga volcano in Iceland and debating what may happen next; eruption has been relatively peaceful, but active volcanoes can be unpredictable.
lead_paragraph: Volcanic eruptions are among the earth’s most cataclysmic events, but scientists are often reduced to analyzing possibilities within possibilities when making forecasts.

headline.seo: Predicting Volcanoes’ Activity Is Tricky, and for Iceland, Nerve-Racking
headline.main: Pressure, and Mystery, on the Rise
headline.print_headline: Pressure, and Mystery, on the Rise
